results.title: What on earth are we doing?
results.brief_description: Canadians are chewing up their resources at an alarming rate, fifty times faster than the people of India, for example. If we calculated our population according to our rate of consumption, we would have a country of 1.1 billion people. Fortunately, more and more of us are becoming aware of the urgent need to build a way of life based not just on “more” but on “better.” This film suggests some new things for us to do.

results.title: What now?
results.creator_credit: Pregnancy Problem Centre, True Colours Productions and Mark Nebauer
results.brief_description: Using real interviews and mock footage, this short film explores the issue of unwanted pregnancy with a slight slant towards pro-choice. Marion, Linda and Jody, three women of varying ages and from different backgrounds, talk candidly of what it was like to find themselves unexpectedly pregnant, the choices they made; abortion, adoption, keeping the baby, and how it has affected their lives today. Doctor Carolyn Russell discusses the emotional and physical phases of pregnancy as well as a brief overview of what goes on in an abortion. A guide accompanies the video to promote discussion.

results.title: What next?: career aspirations
results.brief_description: An open-ended dramatization designed as a discussion starter about a father who is stunned to learn that his teenage son is not interested in taking over the family business. Sam decides to work in his father’s bakery after leaving school only because his father wishes it. When Sam’s father becomes ill, Harvey decides to help his friend Sam in the bakery. Sam copes well but Harvey is totally unsuited to the job.

results.title: What Mary Jo wanted
results.brief_description: Mary Jo wants a puppy more than anything. She gets her wish and the chance to show that she is prepared to care for it properly, even though it isn’t always easy. Presents a realistic depiction for children of the responsibilities involved in pet care and ownership. Based on the book by Janice May Udry.

results.title: What makes weather?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and David Jay
results.brief_description: Explains the concepts and terminology of weather forecasting. Uses time-lapse cinematography to show cloud formations and topical influences, and live-action experiments and animation to illustrate unequal heating and the resulting effects of cold and warm air masses.

results.title: What makes the wind blow?
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
This film studies the causes of a typical onshore sea breeze and a violent wind storm. It shows laboratory experiments designed to discover the possible causes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: What makes rain
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Kay
results.brief_description: Designed for primary classes this film answers the child’s question, “What makes rain?”, dealing simply with the water cycle and the nature and causes of rainfall. Examines cloud formation, traces the origin of raindrops, hail, sleet and snow. Also shows what happens in areas where rain does not fall.

results.title: What makes me, me
results.creator_credit: Robbie Palm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: One of Robbie Palm’s favourite things is fishing at the creek of his nan’s property. Even though he goes to boarding school in Brisbane, he returns during school holidays to fish. He has been taught by his family the techniques and it is this, and when he plays the Didgeridoo that Robbie feels most connected to his culture. When he plays, he feels proud and watched by his family, both current and past.
